title: Wilfried Zaha responds to West Ham fans accusing him of spitting at Declan Rice
text:
Wilfried Zaha was accused of spitting at Declan Rice in Palace’s win over West Ham (Getty Images)

Wilfried Zaha has hit back at claims suggesting that he spat at Declan Rice during Crystal Palace’s 2-1 win over West Ham on Saturday.

Sebastien Haller opened the scoring for West Ham but Palace equalised through Patrick van Aanholt’s penalty before Jordan Ayew scored the winner in the 87th minute.

But Zaha was accused by West Ham fans of spitting at Rice in the second half following a video which surfaced on Twitter after the match.

But the Ivory Coast international insists he did not spit at the West Ham midfielder and has accused supporters of ‘making up lies’.

‘Let me clear up something that the West Ham fans are trying to make up,’ Zaha said on Instagram.

‘On your own video you can see that Declan runs in front of me and I spit to the right.

‘So please, don’t make up lies that I spat at someone.

‘Because I’ve never done it and I never will, so please, let’s just accept that we won the game and move on.

‘To be totally honest, normally I wouldn’t even care about things like this.

‘But making up lies, that’s not it, you can dislike me, you can feel however you feel about me, just don’t make up nonsense.’
